meanings.definition: A compound containing one atom of oxygen combined with one atom of another element.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the protoxides in the lab.
meanings.sent2: The protoxides reacted with the metal to form a new substance.
meanings.sent3: The protoxides seemed to dance under the microscope, much to the amusement of the researchers.
meanings.sent4: Her curiosity about protoxides was like a spark igniting a fire of scientific exploration.
meanings.sent5: The vivid color of the protoxides made them stand out in the chemical mixture.

meanings.definition: The first or earliest form of an oxide.
meanings.sent1: In the history of chemistry, protoxides were the initial discoveries.
meanings.sent2: The ancient alchemists sought to understand the nature of protoxides.
meanings.sent3: The idea of protoxides being the 'babies' of oxides made the students chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The protoxides of knowledge were just the tip of the iceberg in the vast sea of science.
meanings.sent5: The protoxides of creativity bubbled in the minds of the inventors, ready to evolve into full-fledged ideas.
